alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 5:38AM PST until further notice by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall will result in widespread ponding of water on area roadways with flooding of low lying areas and intersections. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate to heavy rain across southern and western portions of Santa Barbara County. The rain will spread across the remainder of the county by 7 AM PST. Automated rain gauges indicated rainfall rates of 0.20 and 0.40 inches per hour across much of southern and western Santa Barbara County, with local rates up to one half inch per hour. A few locations in the foothills have received more than 1 inch of rain in the past three hours. Flooding of roadways is imminent and will likely continue through at least mid morning. There is a chance that rainfall rates will increase, and if that occurs, the rain could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent burn scars. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Maria, Santa Barbara, Lompoc, Santa Ynez, Montecito, Carpinteria, Solvang, Vandenberg Air Force Base, Los Alamos, Highway 101 through Gaviota State Park, Isla Vista, Orcutt, Cuyama, Summerland, Rincon Point, Goleta and Guadalupe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
